subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Why Is There Something Rather Than Nothing?
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Is There Something Rather Than Nothing?.

hook.text: Why does anything exist at all? Science describes what exists. It can't explain why existence itself exists.

buildup.text: Leibniz asked this question in 1714. Heidegger called it the most fundamental question in philosophy. It remains open.

discovery.text: Science can trace causes back to the Big Bang. But what caused the Big Bang? At some point, every chain of causes ends.

twist.text: Some physicists say the universe emerged from quantum fluctuation. But quantum fields are something, not nothing.

climax.text: This question may be where science and religion genuinely meet. Both face the same wall of mystery at the beginning.

punchline.text: Why does anything exist? Science and religion hit the same wall of mystery.

quiz.question: Why is 'why is there something rather than nothing' significant?
options: It's a question that pushes both science and religion to their limits
